actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Rules.
Committee on Rules. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Rules. Reported to Senate by Senator Ford without amendment. With written report No. 101-27.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 62.
Indefinitely postponed by Senate by Unanimous Consent.

official_title: A joint resolution to establish separate appropriation accounts for the Senate and the House of Representatives for the payment of official mail costs.

summary.text: Establishes the Senate Official Mail Costs Account within the contingent fund of the Senate and the House Official Mail Costs Account within the contingent fund of the House of Representatives. Requires the Senate Committee on Rules and Administration and the House Commission on Congressional Mailing Standards to prescribe rules and regulations governing franked mail. Requires a Member of Congress to repay postage costs in excess of the amount allocated to such Member. Sets forth a formula for determining mass mailing limitations. Requires quarterly reports to Members on expenses incurred by them for mass mail. Requires a separate appropriation for the House and the Senate for franked mailings.

titles.title: A joint resolution to establish separate appropriation accounts for the Senate and the House of Representatives for the payment of official mail costs.
